member.name: T:Intersoft.Client.UI.Aqua.UXInput.FileUploadPostData
member.summary: Represents upload related data that submitted to server during file upload.

member.name: P:Intersoft.Client.UI.Aqua.UXInput.FileUploadPostData.TargetFolder
member.summary: Gets or sets the target folder of the file upload. This property will be ignored if the property is specified.
member.remarks: You can specify relative server path when the ASP.NET Http Handler is used, i.e, ~/Upload.

member.name: P:Intersoft.Client.UI.Aqua.UXInput.FileUploadPostData.TargetPhysicalFolder
member.summary: Gets or sets the target physical folder of the file upload. When specified, the value of this property overrides the property.

member.name: P:Intersoft.Client.UI.Aqua.UXInput.FileUploadPostData.TargetWebUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the absolute web address that contains the uploaded files.
member.remarks:
When specified, it allows the upload control to determine the web address of each uploaded file, which is useful for direct access. You can specify the domain of your web server directly, such as "http://domain.com/upload".
The property also accepts {host} placeholder which automatically resolve the server address and port that process the uploaded file. This feature is useful when you cannot easily determine the name of your server in a load-balanced environment. Example: http://{host}/upload.

member.name: P:Intersoft.Client.UI.Aqua.UXInput.FileUploadPostData.OverwriteExistingFiles
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value that indicates whether existing files should be overwritten.

member.name: P:Intersoft.Client.UI.Aqua.UXInput.FileUploadPostData.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets custom string data to send along with the upload data.

member.name: P:Intersoft.Client.UI.Aqua.UXInput.FileUploadPostData.CustomHeaders
member.summary: Gets or sets a collection of custom headers to send along with the upload data.

member.summary: Gets or sets a collection of custom data to send along with the upload data.

member.name: P:Intersoft.Client.UI.Aqua.UXInput.UXFileUpload.TargetWebUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the absolute web address that contains the uploaded files.
member.remarks:
When specified, it allows the upload control to determine the web address of each uploaded file, which is useful for direct access. You can specify the domain of your web server directly, such as "http://domain.com/upload".
The property also accepts {host} placeholder which automatically resolve the server address and port that process the uploaded file. This feature is useful when you cannot easily determine the name of your server in a load-balanced environment. Example: http://{host}/upload.

member.name: P:Intersoft.Client.UI.Aqua.UXInput.UXFileUpload.TargetPhysicalFolder
member.summary: Gets or sets the target physical folder of the file upload. When specified, the value of this property overrides the property.

member.name: P:Intersoft.Client.UI.Aqua.UXInput.UXFileUpload.TargetFolder
member.summary: Gets or sets the target folder of the file upload. This property will be ignored if the property is specified.
member.remarks: You can specify relative server path when the ASP.NET Http Handler is used, i.e, ~/Upload.
